data.text:
_STORY

Chris Reid (he/him) is a second-generation Canadian settler currently living on the unceded territories of the Musqueam, SkwxwÃº7mesh, and Tsleil-Waututh nations in East Vancouver, BC.

Born in Montreal and raised in Toronto, Chris moved west in 2008 to plant trees in Northern BC. In 2011, a picnic table pitch on Cortez Island, BC catalyzed start-up funding to launch the registered charitable organization Shifting Growth. In 2017, Shifting Growthâ€™s business operations was evolved into Community Garden Builders Inc. to better fulfill the mission of creating temporary community gardens and growing spaces.

In addition to his work as the owner and operator of Community Garden BuildersÂ®, Chris propelled his passion in the health and wellness industry by co-founding the Canadian Pine Pollen Company in 2016. A few more years down, Chris joined the RADIUS Startup Incubator in early 2020 to launch Community Garden App, the first web-based management platform designed specifically for community gardens.

A third trip back to that fateful picnic table on Cortez Island in 2019 led to Chris collaborating and co-founding Arlo Boozy Kombucha with Kara & Bucha Brew Ltd. Still thirsty, Chris then went on to co-found Mr. Yuzu Beverages Inc. with the whole squad of familiar, creative collaborators ~ launching Billion Trillion Sake Fizz in early 2022.

While chilling out, Chris plunged into cold exposure experiences by launching Coold in late 2022. Along the way in 2023, Chris noticed alot more dogs barking in the community gardens and opened Dog Garden spaces ~ where dogs run free.

Throughout the journey, Chris has enjoyed drinking kombucha, indoor fitness classes, outdoor cold plunges, rambunctious dogs and energized forest runs ~ passions that keep him healthy and feeling alive. Most recently, Chris celebrated running the 2022 BMW Berlin Marathon, held in downtown Berlin, Germany. Chris now has set his sights towards completing the Vancouver triathlon in summer 2024.

_EDUCATION

UNIVERSITY OF BRITISH COLUMBIA

Certificate in Project Management (2017)

This program is designed for experienced professionals aiming to build their knowledge and skills in project management to more effectively plan, collaborate and execute projects. The curriculum is compatible with the project management industry standard set by the Project Management Institute (PMI)Â® and the PMBOKÂ® Guide Body of Knowledge. The Business Analysis specialization provides a foundation of business analysis tools and is aligned with the IIBA body of knowledge (BABOKÂ®).

SIMON FRASER UNIVERSITY

Certificate for Community Economic Development Professionals (2015)

This Certificate program provides the latest tools and approaches for practitioners to contribute and build a sustainable, local economy. With a deeper understanding of the role of economic development in sustainable community development, this program focused on sustainable methods and solutions that can be implemented by neighborhoods and communities with limited resources.

UNIVERSITY OF TORONTO

Certificate in Carbon Finance (2011)

The Centre for Environmentâ€™s Certificate in Carbon Finance provides a thorough grounding in a field which aims to help society meet its need to reduce greenhouses gases (GHGs) as rapidly as possible. Carbon Finance explores the financial implications of living in a carbon-contained world. This program focuses on applying innovative market instruments and solutions toward achieving solutions to mitigate climate change and GHG emissions.

CANADA GREEN BUILDING COUNCIL (CAGBC)

Accredited Professional, Leadership in Energy and Environmental Design (2007)

LEED AP ID+C specializes in design, construction and improvement of commercial interiors and tenant spaces that offer a healthy, sustainable and productive work environment. LEED is a green building rating standard that aims to help building owners and operators be environmentally responsible and utilize resources more efficiently.

UNIVERSITY OF WATERLOO, ON

Diploma in Environmental Assessment (2006)

This Diploma focuses on the Environmental Assessment (EA) process at both the Federal and Provincial levels. The EA process provides a mechanism for reviewing major projects to assess their environmental, economic and social sustainability impacts. The assessment process is needed to ensure the issues and concerns of the public, indigenous populations, interested stakeholders and government agencies are considered.

UNIVERSITY OF WATERLOO, ON

Bachelor Environmental Studies, Honours (2006)

This Bachelor program within The Department of Environment and Resource Studies (ERS) focuses on the sustainability and ethics of solving environmental problems, ranging from water and food to energy and biodiversity, utilizing techniques and ideas from many disciplines to seek integrative solutions that cross the boundaries between the natural and social sciences.
